prompts.text: Task: Transform this amateur product photograph into a premium, professional e-commerce studio shot. Goal: The product must look pristine and high-quality, while maintaining pixel-perfect fidelity to all original text and branding details. 1. Background & Isolation: Isolate the product perfectly from the floor background. Place it on a seamless, pure white background (#FFFFFF). 2. General Surface Enhancement (Non-Text Areas): On the main fabric and materials *only*, gently smooth out unsightly wrinkles, creases, and remove dust or dirt to create a flawless, new appearance. Ensure materials look premium. 3. CRITICAL: Extreme Text and Label Preservation (PROTECTED ZONES): The model MUST NOT apply any smoothing, denoising, blurring, or 'cleaning' effects to areas containing text, logos, or small labels. All alphanumeric text, branding details (like 'NIKE GRIPKNIT'), sizing tags, and fine print must remain incredibly SHARP, CRISP, and LEGIBLE. Treat these areas as protected high-fidelity zones. It is better to leave a tiny imperfection near text than to blur the text itself. The text must be identical to the source image, just cleaner. 4. Perspective & Lighting: Strictly maintain the exact camera angle and perspective seen in the input image. Do not rotate or tilt the object. Replace the amateur lighting with professional, soft, even studio lighting that defines the form. Add a subtle, realistic contact shadow on the white floor so the product does not look like it is floating. 5. Framing: Center the product fully within the frame with balanced white space.

Task: High-Fidelity Background Replacement & Studio Lighting Composition. Goal: Isolate the product EXACTLY as it appears in the source image onto a white background. 1. Background: Seamless pure white (#FFFFFF). Add a natural, soft contact shadow to ground the object. 2. Source Fidelity (CRITICAL): Do NOT 'regenerate', 'repaint', or 'smooth' the product texture. The goal is to preserve the authentic reality of the item, not to create a 3D render. Keep the original fabric texture and material definition exactly as provided in the input. 3. Text Protection: The text, logos, and labels (e.g., 'NIKE GRIPKNIT', size tags) must be preserved pixel-for-pixel from the original. Do not apply any denoising or beautification filters to text areas. They must remain sharp and readable. 4. Lighting: Adjust only the global exposure and contrast to match a professional studio look. Do not alter the local shadows or highlights on the shoe itself to ensure the design remains 100% accurate. 5. Framing: Center the product with balanced white space.

Task: Technical Background Replacement & Color Correction ONLY. Goal: Isolate the product exactly as it appears in the source image onto a white background. 1. STRICT OBJECT PRESERVATION (CRITICAL): Do NOT redraw, re-render, repaint, or 'clean' the product structure. The pixels constituting the shoes (fabric texture, laces, and especially TEXT/LOGOS) must remain identical to the source image. Do not attempt to fix wrinkles or texture if it risks altering the text. Authenticity is the priority over 'perfect' smoothness. 2. Text & Label Integrity: Absolutely NO smoothing, blurring, or changing of text areas (e.g., 'NIKE GRIPKNIT', tags). Treat the product as a 'protected layer' that cannot be modified, only brightened. 3. Background: Replace the floor with seamless pure white (#FFFFFF). 4. Lighting Adjustment: Apply GLOBAL brightness and contrast adjustments only to match studio standards. Do not change the lighting direction or cast new shadows on the shoe structure itself. 5. Output: The result should look like the original photo was skillfully cut out and placed on white, NOT like a 3D render or a generated image.

This is a forensic garment reconstruction task, NOT an image enhancement or creative generation task.

ROLE: Technical Forensic E-commerce Ghost Mannequin Reconstruction System

PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
Project the provided garment onto an invisible ghost mannequin form using strictly geometric repositioning, while preserving absolute pixel fidelity and authentic garment condition.

Treat all garment pixels as READ-ONLY source data.

You are allowed to reposition pixels spatially, but you are NOT allowed to modify pixel color, brightness, contrast, texture, or condition in any way.

----------------------------------------------------------------

ABSOLUTE FORENSIC PRESERVATION RULES

1. ZERO PIXEL MODIFICATION

Do NOT alter:

- brightness
- contrast
- saturation
- white balance
- levels
- gamma
- color balance

Do NOT:

- enhance
- denoise
- sharpen
- smooth
- clean
- normalize
- relight
- improve fabric appearance

All fading, bleaching, discoloration, lint, pilling, wrinkles, and defects must remain fully visible and unchanged.

Pixel RGB values must remain mathematically identical to the source image.

Only spatial repositioning is allowed.

----------------------------------------------------------------

2. ORIENTATION LOCK (CRITICAL)

Preserve the EXACT original camera orientation.

DO NOT:

- rotate
- tilt
- skew
- flip
- reinterpret camera angle
- change perspective

The garment must remain perfectly front-facing, vertical, and camera-parallel exactly as photographed.

----------------------------------------------------------------

3. GEOMETRIC PROJECTION ONLY

Simulate natural garment fit on an invisible mannequin using geometric warping only.

DO NOT:

- generate new fabric texture
- invent folds
- hallucinate missing fabric
- reconstruct nonexistent detail

Only reposition existing pixels.

----------------------------------------------------------------

4. GARMENT CONTINUITY RULE (CRITICAL — PREVENTS WHITE HOOD VOID)

The garment must remain a continuous physical object.

If interior areas become visible (hood interior, neck opening, sleeve openings):

Use this priority order:

Priority 1:
Use real interior pixels if available.

Priority 2:
Use adjacent garment pixels via geometric projection to maintain natural fabric continuity.

Priority 3:
Only use pure white (#FFFFFF) if the opening truly represents empty background and no garment continuation logically exists.

DO NOT create artificial white voids inside hoods, collars, or sleeves if fabric continuity logically exists.

Interior garment areas should appear naturally darker consistent with original exposure.

----------------------------------------------------------------

5. BACKGROUND REQUIREMENT

Replace background with pure solid white:

#FFFFFF

Requirements:

- No gradients
- No shadows
- No tonal variation
- No studio simulation
- No environmental lighting

Background must be uniform and flat.

----------------------------------------------------------------

6. SHADOW RULE

Remove all external shadows completely.

DO NOT create:

- drop shadows
- contact shadows
- soft shadows
- artificial shadows

Garment must appear naturally floating.

----------------------------------------------------------------

7. LIGHTING AUTHENTICITY RULE

Preserve original garment lighting exactly.

DO NOT:

- relight garment
- simulate studio lighting
- add artificial highlights
- add artificial shading

Lighting must remain identical to source photograph.

----------------------------------------------------------------

8. CGI AND SYNTHETIC LOOK PROHIBITION

The output must NOT look like:

- CGI render
- 3D render
- AI generated image
- synthetic fabric

The output must look exactly like a real photograph taken with the same camera and lighting.

Maintain real camera imperfections and natural fabric realism.

----------------------------------------------------------------

FINAL AUTHENTICITY REQUIREMENT

The final output must be indistinguishable from a real ghost mannequin studio photograph of the exact same garment.

The garment must look used, real, imperfect, and authentic — exactly matching the source image condition.

No improvements. No corrections. No enhancements.

Forensic accuracy is mandatory.

This is a forensic garment repositioning and background replacement task. This is NOT an image enhancement or image generation task.

Use the provided garment image as the only source.

PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:

Reposition the garment into a clean, symmetric, professional flat-lay position suitable for e-commerce while preserving absolute pixel fidelity.

Replace the background with pure white (#FFFFFF).

----------------------------------------------------------------

CRITICAL PIXEL PRESERVATION RULES

Treat all garment pixels as READ-ONLY.

DO NOT modify in any way:

- color
- brightness
- contrast
- saturation
- white balance
- levels
- texture

DO NOT:

- enhance
- clean
- repair
- improve
- denoise
- sharpen
- smooth

All fading, bleaching, discoloration, fabric wear, wrinkles, lint, and defects must remain fully visible and unchanged.

Pixel colors must remain mathematically identical to the source image.

Only spatial repositioning is allowed.

----------------------------------------------------------------

GEOMETRIC REPOSITIONING INSTRUCTIONS

Reposition the garment into a natural, symmetric flat-lay configuration.

Requirements:

- Center the garment vertically and horizontally.
- Align the torso perfectly vertical.
- Make the left and right sides symmetric.
- Reposition sleeves into natural relaxed positions with equal angles.
- Ensure both arms appear balanced and evenly spaced.
- Preserve natural fabric wrinkles and condition.

DO NOT rotate the garment unnaturally.

DO NOT change camera perspective.

Only perform realistic physical repositioning as if adjusted by hand.

----------------------------------------------------------------

BACKGROUND REPLACEMENT

Remove the original background completely.

Replace with pure white background:

#FFFFFF

Requirements:

- No shadows
- No gradients
- No texture
- No lighting simulation

Flat, clinical white background only.

----------------------------------------------------------------

LIGHTING PRESERVATION

Preserve original garment lighting exactly.

DO NOT relight.

DO NOT simulate studio lighting.

Maintain original exposure and shadows on the garment itself.

----------------------------------------------------------------

REALISM REQUIREMENT

The final result must look exactly like a real photograph taken with the same camera, where the garment was manually repositioned and photographed on a white background.

The garment must look real, used, and authentic.

It must NOT look like AI-generated or artificially enhanced.

----------------------------------------------------------------

FINAL RESULT REQUIREMENT

Produce a clean, symmetric, centered flat-lay garment image with pure white background while preserving 100% of original garment condition and pixel fidelity.
